Use when implementing privacy controls, conducting data protection impact assessments, ensuring regulatory compliance, or managing data subject rights. security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown guidance and code examples demonstrating privacy compliance best practices. No executable code, network calls, file access, or system modifications. The code examples are illustrative educational content showing proper implementation patterns for data subject rights, consent management, and regulatory compliance.

content.value_statement: Organizations face complex regulatory requirements when handling personal data across GDPR, CCPA, HIPAA, and other data protection laws. This skill provides comprehensive guidance for implementing compliant privacy practices, managing data subject rights, and building privacy-by-design systems.
actual_capabilities: Guide implementation of GDPR, CCPA, and HIPAA compliance programs
Create handlers for data subject access, deletion, and portability requests
Design consent management systems with granular user controls
Draft privacy policies and breach notification procedures
Implement privacy-by-design principles and data minimization
limitations: Provides guidance only, does not execute compliance actions
Does not replace professional legal advice for specific cases
Does not integrate directly with compliance software or tools

prompt_templates.title: Basic Compliance Help
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain the key requirements of GDPR for our startup that processes user data in the EU. Include lawful bases for processing and data subject rights.

prompt_templates.title: Implement Access Requests
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to implement a right to access request handler that collects all personal data for a user and generates a downloadable report within GDPR timelines.

prompt_templates.title: Design Consent System
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a consent management implementation with granular opt-in controls for analytics, marketing, and essential cookies that complies with GDPR requirements.

prompt_templates.title: Conduct DPIA
prompt_templates.prompt: Guide me through conducting a Data Protection Impact Assessment for a new AI-powered user profiling feature. Include risk assessment framework and mitigation strategies.

output_examples.input: How do I implement GDPR-compliant data deletion with exceptions for legal retention requirements?
output: When handling deletion requests, first verify the user's identity using email verification.
Check for legal obligations that may require retaining certain data (tax records, contracts, ongoing legal claims).
If retention is required, respond with partial_deletion status and document the legal basis.
For deletable data, remove from database, backups (mark for cycle deletion), analytics, third-party services, and revoke API keys.
Anonymize historical records rather than deleting if needed for analytics.
Send confirmation email and log the request for audit compliance.
Response timeline: 1 month (extendable to 3 months) under GDPR.

best_practices: Implement consent as a continuous process, not a one-time checkbox. Document version, timestamp, purposes, and user context for every consent record.
Apply privacy-by-design from the start. Collect only essential data, define clear purposes, and enforce automated retention policies.
Maintain comprehensive audit logs for all data subject requests. Include timestamps, actions taken, and verification steps for compliance evidence.
anti_patterns: Avoid treating privacy compliance as a one-time checkbox exercise. Regulations evolve and require ongoing monitoring and updates.
Do not use vague or bundled consent. Each purpose requires separate, specific consent that users can withdraw individually.
Avoid collecting data first and asking questions later. Data minimization must be applied at the collection point, not as a retrospective cleanup.

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, OpenAI Codex, and Claude Code. It provides guidance through conversational prompts without requiring API integrations.

faq.question: What are the penalties for non-compliance?
faq.answer: GDPR penalties reach up to ‚Ç¨20M or 4% of global revenue. CCPA fines reach $7,500 per intentional violation. HIPAA penalties can reach $1.5M per violation category annually.

faq.question: How do I integrate this with my existing tools?
faq.answer: Use the guidance to inform your design decisions. Code examples can be adapted to your specific tech stack for implementing consent managers, request handlers, and compliance workflows.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only provides guidance through the conversation. No data is stored, transmitted externally, or accessed by any external systems.

faq.question: The guidance does not cover my specific situation. What now?
faq.answer: This skill provides general compliance guidance. For specific legal interpretations, edge cases, or industry-specific requirements, consult a qualified privacy attorney.

faq.question: How is this different from compliance software?
faq.answer: Compliance software automates policy enforcement and documentation. This skill provides strategic guidance for designing compliant systems, drafting policies, and understanding regulatory requirements.
